documents.content: Auburn Regional Clinic's quarterly audit report highlights a 38% increase in claims related to vestibular schwannoma treatments among policyholders aged 25-40 in the Puget Sound region. Dr. Elaine Voss at Seattle Neurocare initiated a pilot program using gamma knife radiosurgery, with Policy #GKRS-229 requiring pre-authorization for metastatic cases. Patient ID N7742 underwent treatment on 03/15/2023 with notable balance improvement documented at 6-week follow-up.

Research Note (Study ACU-445): Participant RK-29 (DOB 08/12/1991) completed vestibular rehabilitation at Bothell Balance Center under Dr. Mira Patel's supervision. Treatment included weekly sessions using computerized dynamic posturography from 04/2023-06/2023. Concurrent insurance claims show coordination between Policy #GKRS-229 coverage and supplemental PT benefits under Group Plan NW-882.

Insurance memo dated 07/01/2023 announces Policy #GKRS-229 updates: Requires vestibular testing within 14 days prior to radiosurgery for non-metastatic schwannoma cases in Washington State. Claims processor Renata Okoye noted increased approvals for younger patients after implementing the 15-point quality checklist developed by Dr. Voss's team.

Seattle Times health section reports on innovative schwannoma treatments at regional centers (08/04/2023). Features patient Christopher Duvall (Policy NW-882 holder) describing his recovery journey through combined gamma knife and rehabilitation at Bothell Balance Center. Article mentions upcoming congressional hearing about insurance coverage for rare neurological conditions.

metadata.content_summary: Coordinated case of vestibular schwannoma treatment through gamma knife radiosurgery (Policy #GKRS-229) and rehabilitation via Study ACU-445, with associated policy changes and media coverage

questions.q: Which two treatments did Christopher Duvall receive for vestibular schwannoma under Policy NW-882?
questions.a: Gamma knife radiosurgery and vestibular rehabilitation at Bothell Balance Center

questions.q: What policy update implemented a 15-point checklist for vestibular schwannoma treatment approvals?
What diagnostic test and treatment timeline occurred for patient ID N7742 and study participant RK-29?
questions.a: Vestibular testing within 14 days prior to 03/15/2023 gamma knife procedure

questions.q: What regional trend and policy change addressed vestibular schwannoma treatment for patients aged 25-40?
questions.a: 38% claims increase led to Policy #GKRS-229 requiring pre-authorization for metastatic cases
